Articles.Content:
Thanks for all the attention.

@nicky4096: I deleted my save when 0.90.0 came out. So there will be no front shot. It is all good, I will try again after a while.

Also, I have no idea why it is saying there is extra fuel. It is just like you said with the single round-8 and the 4 oscar-Bs.

@TheAnimePug: Fuel lines from the external tanks to the front landing gear, then a fuel line from the landing gear back into the first tank.

Edited December 17, 2014 by Zipmafia

Thanks for all the attention.

@nicky4096: I deleted my save when 0.90.0 came out. So there will be no front shot. It is all good, I will try again after a while.

Also, I have no idea why it is saying there is extra fuel. It is just like you said with the single round-8 and the 4 oscar-Bs.

@TheAnimePug: Fuel lines from the external tanks to the front landing gear, then a fuel line from the landing gear back into the first tank.

i hope to see your re-do!
I might just swipe all the old records vlean because of 0,90 it allows for shipt to be built that couldn't been done before idk if i should though

I might just swipe all the old records vlean because of 0,90 it allows for shipt to be built that couldn't been done before idk if i should though

i dont think you should, because the physics and flameout logic are still all the the same as before. so while it is easier to clip things now, its nothing that couldnt be done before with some cubic struts.

just my opinion though

Here is attempt #2. I think I can go faster still, but this is all I'm willing to do right now.

Lets call it "The Gnat"

Yeah, I was thinking about that when I was taking screen shots. Those wings go FLYING off when I decouple them. I could probably get a pick of them in the distance, but actually catching the decoupling is going to be hard.

Hope I can still make the leaderboard. If not not sweat, I'm going to try this again eventually.

Yeah, I was thinking about that when I was taking screen shots. Those wings go FLYING off when I decouple them. I could probably get a pick of them in the distance, but actually catching the decoupling is going to be hard.

Hope I can still make the leaderboard. If not not sweat, I'm going to try this again eventually.

some things you could try:

1) try using the tiny stack sperators that have 15 ejection force. or even docking ports! but that adds extra mass.

2) ditch the wings entrirely and rely on SAS torque (you can ditch that in space later)

3) give animepug the craft file

however i think you should be accepted anyway. i avoid that problem with horrible computer
Ill add you to the new 0.90 list! i figured i wont delete the old results but 0.90 does add a whole lot more control because of the pilots so new list old one still there!
Just giving this post another comment so it shows up in the top list again

if i do a run in 0.24.2 will it be added to the old leaderboard?

(i dont have 0.25 or 0.9)

if i do a run in 0.24.2 will it be added to the old leaderboard?

ye s you will be on the old leader board i see no use in not updating though

ye s you will be on the old leader board i see no use in not updating though

sorry for the uber late reply. was on a trip for like AN ENTIRE DAY WITHOUT INTERNET 0.0 scary....

so, i will make an entry soon.

the reason for not updating is that i cant get it to work

but roughly around christmas time i should get it working (hopefully)

well, i eventually got so tired of failed lag-monsters that i tried to see how fast a 1 intake design could go.

2149 m/s, and it wasnt very well optimized either! i think i can beat 2200 m/s with 1 intake, but thats for later.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

EDIT: as always im dumb. its unmanned, stock (except for time control, shouldnt affect flight), and called "PFU 1"

well... i added a smaller fuel tank for the speed run and drop tanks, and hit 2300 m/s.

another 5 m/s and ill be on the top 20 with only 1 intake!!!! though it is unmanned, eventually ill see if i can hit 2305 m/s with a seat.

Forgot to note, .90 for mine, updated.

I'd like to enter my jet, the Porco Dio. It's manned, stock, version 0.90, and reached a speed of 2305 m/s.

http://imgur.com/a/aCPI5

So my little spaceplane didn't get any attention (Sad face), but hopefully with my new ones about to be released, it'll get some much needed love . However, I think that I have indeed broken the record... http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108562-The-Idon-Series

Although I do not have a picture of the final summary, I can whip that up in a second. As the resource panel shows, the only thing I used was my jet engine. I achieved a speed of 2350.8, and I believed I reached 2355 at one point... If this could be a contender, I'll get some new shots of the plane in action and the after flight summary. Even if this doesn't break the record, considering how large this plane is (and it is an SSTO!) I think that 2350 is pretty darn impressive.

- - - Updated - - -

It uses part clipping though.

- - - Updated - - -

Nevermind, was looking at orbital speed XD
